column2: a platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers
an open-source container orchestration platform for automating the deployment and management of containerized apps
a portable and self-sufficient unit that encapsulates an application and its dependencies
a stand-alone, executable software package that includes code, runtime, libraries, and system tools needed to run a piece of software
a script used to create a Docker image, specifying the instructions for building the image layer by layer
a process of packaging an application and its dependencies into a container for easy deployment and scaling
a centralized repository for storing and distributing Docker images
a tool for defining and running multi-container Docker applications
an automated arrangement, coordination, and management of multiple containers to ensure they work together efficiently
a group of containers that work together to provide a specific application component or function
a YAML-formatted configuration file for defining and managing multi-container Docker applications; it specifies the services, networks, and volumes required for the application
a cloud-based repository where Docker users can create, test, store, and distribute Docker images
a specially-designated directory within one or more containers, designed to persist data, independent of the container's life cycle
a directory or file on the Docker host's filesystem that is mounted into a container
a type of Docker volume that is managed by Docker and identified by a specific name; Docker determines the storage location of named volumes on the host machine
a type of volume that is automatically created and managed by Docker without a specific name
an image modification, represented by an instruction in the Dockerfile
a native Go implementation for creating containers with namespaces, cgroups, capabilities, and filesystem access controls
a native Go implementation for creating and managing container network namespaces and resources
Docker's native clustering and orchestration tool, turns a pool of Docker hosts into a single, virtual Docker host
a feature of Docker that enables the orchestration of containers across multiple Docker hosts
a set of Docker images
a named endpoint configuration that allows switching between multiple Docker environments
a physical or virtual machine running an instance of the Docker Engine inÂ swarm mode
